bug.short_desc: PackageFragment.getAttachedJavadoc returns the complete HTML page rather than the package documentation section.

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 223906 Package hover when the content is taken from attached java doc
The method getAttachedJavadoc(IProgressMonitor monitor) in the class PackageFragment is returning the complete HTML content of package-summary.html file. So when we hovering over a package declaration, the contents are displayed as in a web browser rather than in the text view. This is giving us an inconsistent hover view.
Checked the getAttachedJavadoc(IProgressMonitor monitor) for other JavaElements. There after retrieving the URLContent, a JavadocContents object is created and it then returns javadocContents.getTypeDoc(). This works well with hover.
It would be appreciated if the getAttachedJavadoc(IProgressMonitor monitor) of PackageFragment returns the section that contains the package documentation rather than the complete HTML content.

You expect to see only this:
Package java.io Description
Provides for system input and output through data streams, serialization and the file system. Unless otherwise noted, passing a null argument to a constructor or method in any class or interface in this package will cause a NullPointerException to be thrown.
for java.io for example?
Yes, only the package description from the package-summary.html file.
Please provide the fix for M4 since JDT UI is doing major work in this area which depends on this fix.
Jay, please follow up - this is needed for M4.

Jay, during the week-end I started to work on it. You might want to start from there. Things that has to be improved: - when the anchor is not there for the package description, you might want to return an empty doc. This would be the case if the package has no doc. It doesn't mean that this is an unknown format. - review the code and add new regression tests.

(In reply to comment #5) > Jay, during the week-end I started to work on it. > You might want to start from there. > Things that has to be improved: > - when the anchor is not there for the package description, you might want > to return an empty doc. This would be the case if the package has no doc. It > doesn't mean that this is an unknown format. > - review the code and add new regression tests.
Thanks, Olivier, In fact, I almost had a complete patch too and was about to post the patch :( The patches are very similar, the main difference being that I have the following for the PACKAGE_DESCRIPTION_START
char[] PACKAGE_DESCRIPTION = "name=\"package_description\"".toCharArray(); //$NON-NLS-1$
This will ensure that it will still work when there are additional attributes before "name". The other difference is that I return an empty doc when we don't find the package_description. I will merge both these patches and release the fix shortly.

Created attachment 224015 Updated patch
Contains the changes as described in the previous comment and few other changes + regression tests.

Created attachment 224016 Binaries for tests
These go inside /org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.model/workspace/AttachedJavadocProject

(In reply to comment #8) > Created attachment 224015 [details] > Updated patch > > Contains the changes as described in the previous comment and few other > changes + regression tests.
I just noticed that the patch from Olivier doesn't include the "Related documents" and "Since" tag in the doc. This patch includes them.
Manju/Dani, can you tell me what you think?

(In reply to comment #10) > (In reply to comment #8) > > Created attachment 224015 [details] [diff] > > Updated patch > > > > Contains the changes as described in the previous comment and few other > > changes + regression tests. > > I just noticed that the patch from Olivier doesn't include the "Related > documents" and "Since" tag in the doc. This patch includes them. > > Manju/Dani, can you tell me what you think?
1. create a package.html and a package-info 2. create the Javadoc 3. attach it 4. use the JDT Core API ==> result should match 1. and nothing else.

Created attachment 224030 Updated patch
This patch doesn't have the extra "Package ... Description" and lot closer to the original. To be precise, the only extra would be the the preceding white-space character. I haven't bothered to remove that because that would mean we will be making too much assumption about the format.
Manju, please let me know what your testing shows.

Created attachment 224032 Updated binaries
Removed unnecessary white-space from the test javadoc.
The latest updated patch works as requested. Now the package hover view looks consistent when the content is queried from package.html, package-info.java or from the attached java doc.
Marking as verified for 4.3 M4 as per confirmation from JDT/UI.

attachment.desc: Package hover when the content is taken from attached java doc
